intro: Filago texana, commonly known as the Texas filago, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Filago texana is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of woodlands in Texas.
